comments:
Overview Description:  
Deleted a volume from a DS4000 Storage Subsystem using Aperi GUI wizard, received the following error messages:
1/3/07 3:41:56 PM BTACS0000I Starting Control Process: deleteStorageVolumes, Device Server RUN ID=6, Job ID=64.
1/3/07 3:41:56 PM HWN021684I Started deletion of volume 11 on subsystem FAStT500-TPC_L2_FASTT-600A0B80000C50E200000000440F238D-LSI.
1/3/07 3:41:56 PM HWN021686E Volume deletion failed. Volume 11 on subsystem FAStT500-TPC_L2_FASTT-600A0B80000C50E200000000440F238D-LSI could not be deleted.
1/3/07 3:41:56 PM HWN021503E An internal error occurred, please try again. If the problem persist, please contact IBM service.
1/3/07 3:41:56 PM BTACS0001I Finished Control Process: Device Server RUN ID=6, Job ID=64, Status=0, Return Code=10007.
 

Steps to Reproduce:
            Using Aperi Disk Manager GUI wizard to unassign the ports associated to the volume, then delete it.

Actual Results:

The delete job failed with the trace records as follows:
org.eclipse.aperi.disk.api.impl.DiskManagerService deleteStorageVolumes
2007.01.03 15:41:56.750-08:00 Msg: HWN021684I Started deletion of volume 11 on subsystem FAStT500-TPC_L2_FASTT-600A0B80000C50E200000000440F238D-LSI. @(-9223372036854771931;[-9223372036854775700,0,1];6;DiskManagerThread-5 - deleteStorageVolumes([org.eclipse.aperi.disk.control.util.DeleteStorageVolumesParameter: {CIMOM: null; Storage Volume IDs: {}}]))   org.eclipse.aperi.disk.control.StorageConfigurationPluginFAStT11 deleteStorageVolumes
2007.01.03 15:41:56.750-08:00 Msg: HWN021686E Volume deletion failed. Volume 11 on subsystem FAStT500-TPC_L2_FASTT-600A0B80000C50E200000000440F238D-LSI could not be deleted. @(-9223372036854771931;[-9223372036854775700,0,1];6;DiskManagerThread-5 - deleteStorageVolumes([org.eclipse.aperi.disk.control.util.DeleteStorageVolumesParameter: {CIMOM: null; Storage Volume IDs: {}}]))   org.eclipse.aperi.disk.control.StorageConfigurationPluginFAStT11 deleteStorageVolumes
2007.01.03 15:41:56.750-08:00 HWN099993E HWN021503E @(-9223372036854771931;[-9223372036854775700,0,1];6;DiskManagerThread-5 - deleteStorageVolumes([org.eclipse.aperi.disk.control.util.DeleteStorageVolumesParameter: {CIMOM: null; Storage Volume IDs: {}}]))
  org.eclipse.aperi.common.api.ServerException: HWN021503E An internal error occurred, please try again. If the problem persist, please contact IBM service.
	at org.eclipse.aperi.disk.common.util.DiskMessageHelper.getServerException(DiskMessageHelper.java:149)
	at org.eclipse.aperi.disk.control.StorageConfigurationPlugin.setVolumeDeletionSubjobFailed(StorageConfigurationPlugin.java:1406)
	at org.eclipse.aperi.disk.control.StorageConfigurationPlugin.deleteStorageVolumes(StorageConfigurationPlugin.java:636)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.aperi.disk.common.util.thread.DiskMgrThread.run(DiskMgrThread.java:257)   org.eclipse.aperi.disk.control.StorageConfigurationPluginFAStT11 deleteStorageVolumes
2007.01.03 15:41:56.750-08:00 Msg: HWN021503E An internal error occurred, please try again. If the problem persist, please contact IBM service. @(-9223372036854771931;[-9223372036854775700,0,1];6;DiskManagerThread-5 - deleteStorageVolumes([org.eclipse.aperi.disk.control.util.DeleteStorageVolumesParameter: {CIMOM: null; Storage Volume IDs: {}}]))   org.eclipse.aperi.disk.control.StorageConfigurationPluginFAStT11 deleteStorageVolumes                                  
     
Expected Results:

delete job will run successfully
                                 
Build Date & Platform: 
     Aperi-20070103.085736.zip

Unfortunately the provided portion of the logs does not show the information
that identifies the root cause for the problem.
If the problem was not a temporary issue, please recreate and provide the full device server logs and the access info to the CIMOM.

Please increase the tracelevel for the Disk component by following these instructions:

1) stop Aperi Device Server
2) edit the file <aperi_install>/devsvr/configuration/logging.properties
3) add or edit the following line:
aperi.logger.trace.DiskManager.level=ALL
4) start Aperi Device Server
Once I stopped and restarted the Aperi device server, I was not able to recreate the problem.

traces.message: HWN021503E An internal error occurred, please try again. If the problem persist, please contact IBM service.
